intro: Coenoemersa cualensis, commonly known as the Cualense tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in parts of Brazil and Peru. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils near rivers and in humid forests. Coenoemersa cualensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been studied for its potential ecological and medicinal properties.
